accordion.accordion_title: What is Lexapro and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Lexapro is an antidepressant in a group called selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs). Lexapro is the brand name for a generic medication known as escitalopram. It works by restoring the balance of certain chemicals in the brain.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you need Lexapro, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if it is right for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for Lexapro?
accordion.accordion_intro: Lexapro is used to treat depression and anxiety in adults, as well as major depressive disorder in anyone older than 12 years old.

Lexapro is taken by mouth once a day as directed by a doctor, with or without food. It is available as a tablet and as a liquid. If you are using the liquid, use the provided measuring cup to make sure your dose is precise. To reduce the risk of side effects, your doctor may start you on a lower dose and gradually increase it.
accordion.accordion_content: It may take a few weeks to see an improvement to your mood. If you stop Lexapro suddenly, you may experience withdrawal; always reduce your dose gradually.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of Lexapro?
accordion.accordion_intro:
ypical Lexapro side effects include:

  • Nausea
  • Dry mouth
  • Trouble sleeping
  • Constipation
  • Drowsiness
  • Dizziness
  • Increased sweating
accordion.accordion_content: Speak with your doctor if you experience a decreased sexual drive, changes in sexual ability, increased bruising, signs of serotonin syndrome (fast heart rate, shivering, hallucinations, twitching and/or muscle stiffness). Some people may experience thoughts of suicide when first starting this medication; speak with a doctor immediately if this happens to you.

accordion.accordion_intro: If you have taken an MAO inhibitor in the last 14 days, you should not take Lexapro. Because Lexapro has a risk of QT interval prolongation anyone who has prolonged QT syndrome, previous heart issues, or is taking medication that can affect QT prolongation should not take Lexapro.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
